events.description_preview: This Campbell pop-up market is a great way to grow in community and culture, supporting small busine...
events.description_detail: This Campbell pop-up market is a great way to grow in community and culture, supporting small businesses throughout the bay area!This community, outdoor event is held at The Coffee Shack, a drive-thru coffee shack that will be turned into a destination and take you on a journey through the unique and inspired drinks! This facility gets turned into an outdoor market and a walk-up coffee shop! It is family & dog friendly! We encourage people to bring their pets and children and walk through the many delightful arts, crafts, and food vendors that set up to put on this event!We offer 21+ Vendors, 1-2 Food Trucks, & LIVE music!A raffle will be held with 100 Shack points and a vendor basket! Winner is announced by same day on our instagram (@thecoffeeshack.ca) ! Our makers/vendors come from various locations and have a variety of unique crafts!This event is all about supporting small & local businesses, along with bringing community together and sharing joy & success!Follow our instagram to keep up to date on all the new offerings at The Coffee Shack, and for updates on this event! (IG: @thecoffeeshack.ca) Read moreCategory: Community, City & Town

events.title: Apisol Sparking Honey Drink - Pop Up
events.location: Jiaren Cafe, 1171 Homestead Road, #140b Santa Clara, CA 95050
events.description_preview: Try Apisol‚Äôs sparkling honey drinks and sip on some buzz-worthy fizz!Apisol is a unique sparkling ho...
events.description_detail: Try Apisol‚Äôs sparkling honey drinks and sip on some buzz-worthy fizz!Apisol is a unique sparkling honey drink, unlike anything you‚Äôve ever tasted. Lightly fizzy and refreshing, it‚Äôs made locally in small batches with real Napa Valley honey and all-natural ingredients. This is a FREE event, feel free to drop by anytime!Apisol started as a fun project in my kitchen when I was experimenting with honey and trying to create something light and refreshing. It felt like I moved science from the lab to the kitchen, just with something I actually wanted to drink at the end. And after 189 rounds of trial and error, it finally clicked and became something I wanted to share - Ariana We‚Äôre excited to host this pop-up and to support local creators and small businesses! Please note that each vendor runs their pop-up independently. Jiaren Caf√© is simply providing space and helping introduce their work to our community.By attending, you understand that:All products, services, and purchases are offered directly by the vendor, not by Jiaren Caf√©.Any questions or concerns about items or experiences should be handled with the vendor.Jiaren Caf√© isn‚Äôt responsible for the vendor‚Äôs products, ingredients, or activities, and we‚Äôre not able to take on liability for any issues that may arise.Participation is voluntary and at your own discretion.Thank you for supporting local entrepreneurs and helping us build a creative and safe community space!Read moreCategory: Food & Drink, Other

events.title: Volunteer Outside at McClellan Ranch Preserve
events.location: McClellan Ranch Preserve, 22221 McClellan Rd, Cupertino, CA 95014
events.description_preview: Volunteer your time to improve habitat health in Cupertino!Join Grassroots Ecology in our ongoing re...
events.description_detail: Volunteer your time to improve habitat health in Cupertino!Join Grassroots Ecology in our ongoing restoration of habitat along Stevens Creek at McClellan Ranch Preserve in Cupertino! We will spend our time together installing native plants, weeding invasive species, and making wire cages to protect plants. Volunteers should expect to walk off trail on uneven ground, kneel or sit on kneeling pads, use hand tools, and carry buckets.Visit Grassroots Ecology‚Äôs McClellan Ranch Preserve page to learn more about the ecosystem and accessibility considerations.Waivers/Registration: All volunteers attending the workday must be registered individually and have approved the online waiver through this Eventbrite page. Youth under 18 must have their legal guardian approve the waiver on their behalf. Volunteers age 12 and under require an accompanying adult.Parking: 22221 McClellan Rd, Cupertino, CA 95014, park in the main parking lot in front of the meadow. Additional parking can be found in the overflow lot (located to the left of the main entrance).Alternate Transportation: The closest bus stop (via VTA route 51) is approximately 1 mile away from the preserve. (Note: this route may not run on the weekend). The surrounding neighborhood is bike-friendly and there are plenty of safe places to lock bikes.Meeting Space: We will meet at the picnic tables at the front of the meadow. This site has multi-stall gender-specific restrooms, as well as a water fountain/bottle filling station.Prepare for Working Outdoors:Reusable water bottle (filled with water)Snacks, if desiredLong pants, long sleeves recommendedSturdy closed-toed shoes that can get dirtyHat/sunscreenEpi-Pen or allergy medicine, if applicablePlan for potential exposure to sun, poison oak, ticks, prickly plantsWe will provide gloves, tools, light refreshments, and ponchos (if necessary).Event Cancellations:We are committed to the safety of our staff and volunteers. In the event that we must cancel a workday due to extreme weather conditions or poor air quality, a Grassroots Ecology staff person will reach out via email no later than 5:00 PM the day prior to this event.Join Us!Grassroots Ecology encourages people from all identities and backgrounds to participate in our programs. Many of our programs are outdoors and involve moving and working in a variety of landscapes. If you have accessibility concerns (e.g. allergies, limited mobility, learning differences), our projects are flexible and we are happy to work with you. Please reach out to the workday facilitator so we can prepare for your participation.Accessibility concerns? Questions? Cancellations?Email maya@grassrootsecology.orgRead moreCategory: Charity & Causes, Environment

events.title: Persian Bay Run Crew: Yalda 5K & 10K Social Run (3 Mile & 6 Mile)
events.location: Petals Creamery, 5 North Santa Cruz Avenue, Los Gatos, CA 95030
events.description_preview: Join Persian Bay Run Crew (PBRC) and Petals Creamery for a joyful community run celebrating Yalda ‚Äî ...
events.description_detail: Join Persian Bay Run Crew (PBRC) and Petals Creamery for a joyful community run celebrating Yalda ‚Äî the longest night of the year!Persian Bay Run Crew (PBRC) x Petals Creamery Present:Yalda 5K & 10K Social Run (3 Mile & 6 Mile)Join Persian Bay Run Crew (PBRC) and Petals Creamery for a joyful community run celebrating Yalda ‚Äî the longest night of the year! üåôüçâWe‚Äôre teaming up with Petals Creamery, a Persian culture‚Äìinspired ice cream shop in the heart of Los Gatos, to bring you a run filled with culture, connection, and community.üìÖ Date: Saturday, December 20, 2025‚è∞ Meet Time: 8:45 AMüèÅ Run Start Time: 9:00 AM (We start sharp!)üìç Meet-Up Location: In front of Petals Creamery5 N Santa Cruz Ave, Los Gatos, CA 95030üèÉ Route:We‚Äôll start from Petals Creamery, run along the beautiful Los Gatos Creek Trail toward Vasona Lake, and then loop back to Petals Creamery ‚Äî total distance of 5K (3 miles) or 10K (6 miles) depending on your choice and pace.üëâ Check out our Strava page for full route details!üç¶ After-Run SocialAfter the run, Petals Creamery will open early exclusively for our runners! üéâEnjoy Persian treats and more:And of course ‚Äî don‚Äôt leave without trying their legendary Havij Bastani (carrot ice cream) and other amazing flavors inspired by Persian culture!üëü Who Can Join?Everyone is welcome ‚Äî runners, joggers, and walkers!Whether you‚Äôre an experienced athlete or just looking for a fun, social way to stay active and meet new friends, this event is for you.Let‚Äôs move together, celebrate Yalda, and make the spirit of the season last a little longer. ‚ù§Ô∏èüÖø Parking InfoFree 2-hour parking is available throughout downtown Los Gatos.Recommended spots:Near the meet-up location (there are lots of parking on the street)Los Gatos Public Parking Lot 6 (Behind Petals Creamery), 224 W Main St, Los Gatosüìû Questions?Contact Mohammad at üì± (925) 660-9783Follow Petals Creamery and PBRC to stay connected!Previous Events:Ti-Tap & Chocolate Milk 5K & 10K Social RunNowruz 5K & 10K Social RunYalda 5K Social RunRead moreCategory: Sports & Fitness, Running

events.title: Introduction to Competitive Robotics (Age 8-18)
events.location: Dr Owl Academy, 15445 Los Gatos Boulevard, Los Gatos, CA 95032
events.description_preview: Explore FLL & FTC robotics! Tour the lab, meet coaches, and see live robot demos at our upcoming Ope...
events.description_detail: Explore FLL & FTC robotics! Tour the lab, meet coaches, and see live robot demos at our upcoming Open House. Register now to join the fun!Discover how students learn engineering, coding, and teamwork through FLL (FIRST LEGO League) and FTC (FIRST Tech Challenge) robotics! This Open House is the perfect opportunity for families interested in competitive robotics to see our program in action.What You‚Äôll Experience‚ú® Classroom Tour ‚Äì Explore our robotics labs where students design, build, code, and test their robots.ü§ñ Robot Demonstrations ‚Äì See real FLL robots complete missions and watch our FTC robots drive, spin, lift, and score.üë• Meet the Coaches ‚Äì Talk with our experienced coaching team about our curriculum, competition strategy, and student pathways.üöÄ Learn About FLL & FTC ‚Äì Understand what competitions look like, how teams are formed, and what skills students gain throughout the season.üí¨ Q&A for Parents and Students ‚Äì Get answers about schedules, placement, skill levels, and how to get started.Whether your student is brand new to robotics or eager to join a competitive team, this event will inspire them to take the next step.Spots are limited‚Äîplease register to attend. We look forward to meeting you!Speaker Bio - Ms. ShannonVeteran 10yr robotics coach, numerous awards including multiple regional & state champions, 2nd place in the world (2023), Dean‚Äôs list award (2023), founder and mentor for multiple STEM related non-profit, Degrees in Engineering and Education from Cornell and Stanford UniversityRead moreCategory: Science & Tech, Robotics

events.title: Castro Wine Walk Holiday Edition

events.description_preview: Join us for the Castro Wine Walk! Sip seasonal pours, sip and stroll through local businesses, and c...
events.description_detail: Join us for the Castro Wine Walk! Sip seasonal pours, sip and stroll through local businesses, and celebrate in the gayborhood. ‚ú®üç∑‚ú® Castro Wine Walk ‚ú®üç∑Raise a glass‚Äîit‚Äôs the holiday season in the Castro! On Thursday, December 18, the Castro Merchants Association is uncorking the Castro Wine Walk, where you can sip, swirl, and stroll through local participating businesses.Enjoy seasonal pours‚Äîfrom bold reds to sparkling sips‚Äîwhile soaking in holiday vibes and neighborhood spirit. Each stop will feature a unique wine and a warm welcome, making it the perfect evening to connect with friends, neighbors, and fellow wine lovers, all while supporting local businesses.üç∑ 14 Businesses. Countless Wines. One Festive Night.Whether you‚Äôre here for the pinot, the people-watching, or just an excuse to say cheers, queers, the Castro Wine Walk is the perfect way to celebrate the season.Tickets are limited‚Äîgrab yours today and toast to fall in the Castro! üåàüçÅTickets include:Wine tastings (1-2 per location)Stroll & sip between stops through activation of the Castro Entertainment ZoneSouvenir wine tumblerMap and "punch card"Participating Businesses:The Academy SF ‚Äì LGBTQ+ social club & event space (check-in / 1st stop)La Med Noe ‚Äì Mediterranean restaurant on Noe StreetBlush! Wine Bar ‚Äì Cozy French-style wine bar in the heart of the CastroBar 49 ‚Äì Beer, wine, and cocktails at Castro‚Äôs newest barCopper | Bar Kitchen & Microbrewery ‚Äì LGBT-owned, cozy microbrewery & barLobby Bar ‚Äì Vintage-inspired craft cocktail loungeCanela Bistro & Wine Bar ‚Äì Spanish tapas and wine bar rooted in the CastroCastro Village Wine Co. ‚Äì Boutique California wine shop and tasting barSwirl on Castro ‚Äì Wine bar and shop known for hand-picked selectionsPoesia ‚Äì Cozy Italian restaurant on 18th Street with classic Italian filmsFlora King - Argentinian comfort food + live music & flavorful winesMIdnight Sun - LGBTQIA+ video bar since 1971Rikki's Sports Bar - Read moreCategory: Food & Drink, Wine

events.title: Hands-On: Gnocchi al Burro e Tartufo (Holiday Edition)
events.location: Eataly Silicon Valley, 2855 Stevens Creek Boulevard, San Jose, CA 95128
events.description_preview: It‚Äôs time to dive in, holiday-style! In our hands-on format, our Scuola Instructor will teach you ho...
events.description_detail: It‚Äôs time to dive in, holiday-style! In our hands-on format, our Scuola Instructor will teach you how to make Gnocchi al Burro e Tartufo.About this Class: It‚Äôs time to get your hands messy! In our hands-on format, our Scuola Chef will prepare the signature dish for you to taste in class. You‚Äôll then dive right in to making the recipe yourself from scratch. Take your culinary creation with you at the end of class and enjoy your own hard work at home! Feel the festive spirit in this Holiday Edition of this class. About this Dish: Gnocchi are the traditional Italian form of dumplings made with flour and potatoes. In this decadent dish, we‚Äôll toss the gnocchi in a rich truffle sauce, the perfect dish to elevate your holiday meal and savor a luxurious Italian ingredient. In this Class You Will: Learn about the traditions and culture of Italian truffles Observe as our Scuola Instructor teaches the group how to make Gnocchi al Burro e Tartufo Make your own potato gnocchi by hand Enjoy a menu featuring an antipasto and wine pairing Please Note: One ticket purchase is valid for one guest Seating is first-come, first-served Class duration is approximate and may vary by 10-15 minutes All guests planning to consume alcohol must be able to produce a valid government-issued identification to prove they are 21 or older. Non-alcoholic beverages are available. Classes are also suitable for children 8+ who are passionate about Italian cuisine. 15 and under must be accompanied by a supervising adult. Please notify us in advance if you have any dietary restrictions. If we are not notified ahead of time of any special needs, we may not be able to accommodate them. For any questions, please contact us at esv-scuola@eataly.comCANCELLATION POLICYPayment in full is required at the time of registration and all sales are final. No refunds are offered on classes and events. For groups of 5-10 guests, a minimum of 7 days' notice (class day not included) is required to receive a credit in the form of a coupon for a future class or event. For groups of up to 4 guests, a minimum of 4 days' notice (class day not included) is required to receive a credit in the form of a coupon code for a future class or event at La Scuola. We reserve the right to reschedule or cancel a class or event due to unforeseen circumstances, inclement weather or otherwise. In the event of a class or event cancellation, we will contact you directly at the phone number or email address you have provided to offer a full refund or credit to transfer to a future class or event. While we are not able to offer credit, transfers or refunds for last-minute illnesses, work-related conflicts, personal emergencies or events beyond our control, you are always welcome to send someone in your place, as we understand that these things do happen. If you are purchasing this class or event as a gift, please provide this cancellation policy to the recipient, as the policy will still apply. Credits issued for La Scuola events are redeemable only for future La Scuola events and cannot be used to register for events in other parts of the marketplace or exchanged for store credit or Eataly gift cards.‚ÄãRead moreCategory: Food & Drink, Food

events.title: ¬°BAILA! Community. Dance. Party - Live Salsa ft. Jes√∫s D√≠az y su QBA
events.location: La Pe√±a Cultural Center, 3105 Shattuck Avenue, Berkeley, CA 94705
events.description_preview: La Pe√±a's all-ages monthly Salsa & Bachata night in Berkeley with a live band, inclusive dance class...
events.description_detail: La Pe√±a's all-ages monthly Salsa & Bachata night in Berkeley with a live band, inclusive dance class, and a consent-centered dance floor!Doors 7:30 PM / Class 8 PM / Baile 8 PM - 1 AMBAILA is like a spontaneous dance party that broke out in your kitchen, only if your kitchen had big wood floors, a live Salsa band, a powerful sound system, an upgraded lighting system and 200 of your friends, chosen family, and new faces ready to join the community.At La Pe√±a, we believe that joy and dance are forms of liberation. Movement, like dancing, is essential to our well-being, and gathering in community keeps our spirit alive.That's why every 3rd Friday of the month, La Pe√±a becomes the Bay Area's most joyful and inclusive dance floor.Each edition of BAILA features:8 PM Easy-to-follow gender-inclusive salsa and bachata dance classes10 PM A live Bay Area Salsa bandTwo dance floors with live DJ sets by our resident DJs DJ Jos√© Ru√≠z and DJ RonFood and drinks from our neighbors Los Cilantros Mexican RestaurantFundraising bar that supports La Pe√±a's programsFREE coat checkEveryone is welcome! All ages! BAILA is intentionally created as a safe, gender-inclusive, LGBTQ+ affirming space.Tickets $15-$30:Super Early Bird - $15 (limited quantity available)Early Bird - $20 (available until 2 weeks prior to the event)General Admission Pre-sale - $25 (available until midnight the night before the event)Day of/Door Price - $30Special Discounts & Offers:Student & Senior 65+ Discount - $25 (available online day of event or at the door, valid ID required at check-in)Group Rate - $20 per person (4+ tickets, available online only)2-for-1 Birthday Special - Door Only! Show Birthday flyer at the door. Flyer can be found on our Facebook or Instagram released the week of the event.La Pe√±a Members - FreeAll online ticket sales end when doors open. After that, tickets will only be available for purchase at the door.Join Our Volunteer CommunityVolunteer at BAILA to help create a safer, inclusive space for all! Enjoy free entry, complimentary food and refreshments, and connect with our community.Sign up to volunteer: signup.com/go/VmjiQENLa Pe√±a is a Safer Dance SpaceBAILA is part of La PeÀú√±a's commitment as a Safer Dance Space Member: we are building an empowering dance space rooted in consent culture.This means:Inclusive & Affirming: All genders, LGBTQIA+, and all ages (minors with supervision) are welcome.Zero Tolerance for Harrassment or Abuse: No harrassment (verbal, physical, emotional, or sexual). We expect kindness and respect for all.Responsibile Alcohol Consumption: Be mindful and legal with consumption. Moderation ensures the safety and well-being of all.Respect & Consent: Always ask before dancing or making physical contactShared Responsibility: Together we shape a space where everyone feels safe, valued, and free to express themselves.We value your safety and the safety of our community. Violations of these agreements may result in removal from the event.If you need support during the event seek out a La Pe√±a staff member.If you wish to make a report after the event please use our Contact Us form.Questions?Contact us: programs@Lapena.org or use our Contact Us form‚ÄîAccessibilityLa Pe√±a is a wheelchair-accessible venue with step-less entry, wide doorways, and accessible restrooms.Masks are strongly encouraged. If you‚Äôre experiencing COVID-19, cold, or flu-like symptoms, please consider staying home to protect our community. HEPA air purifiers operate throughout our space.All-gender restrooms availableWe strive to make La Pe√±a a welcoming, accessible space for everyone. If you have any specific needs or questions about accessibility, please contact us at least one week in advance, and we‚Äôll do our best to accommodate. Email us at programs@Lapena.orgSupport La Pe√±aLa Pe√±a is a nonprofit cultural center dedicated to arts, culture, and collective liberation for 50 years.Become a La Pe√±a Member: Membership includes free entry to our monthly dance parties and exclusive perks. Learn MoreDonate Today: Help sustain a space where music, dance, and social justice meet. Learn MoreRead moreCategory: Community, City & Town

events.title: Sound Healing Meditation (Sound Bath) - Los Gatos 7pm
events.location: History Club of Los Gatos, 123 Los Gatos Boulevard, Los Gatos, CA 95030
events.description_preview: RELAX, UNWIND, AND REJUVENATE WITH A DEEPLY NURTURING SOUND HEALING MEDITATION DESIGNED TO MELT AWAY...
events.description_detail: RELAX, UNWIND, AND REJUVENATE WITH A DEEPLY NURTURING SOUND HEALING MEDITATION DESIGNED TO MELT AWAY STRESS AND RESTORE INNER HARMONYA Sound Healing Meditation (aka Sound Bath) is a gentle, nurturing and cathartic meditation experience for anyone looking to improve the quality of their life. This act of self-care is beneficial for anyone from beginners to advanced meditators who are ready to experience a greater sense of peace and well-being.Our Sound Healing Meditations assist in clearing out that which is blocking the natural flow of energy, helping to restore natural vitality while strengthening the connection and balance between mind, body and soul. The safe space created offers participants an opportunity to deepen their own journey of self-love, healing or transformation. While relieving stress, tension and anxiety this sound immersion experience will have you feeling revitalized, relaxed and rejuvenated.When: Thursday December 18, 2025Doors open at 6:00pm. Studio doors lock at 6:55pm and meditation begins promptly at 7:00pm. Due to the nature of the event we are unable to accommodate late entry.Where: History Club of Los Gatos123 Los Gatos Blvd. Los Gatos, CA 95030Please arrive early to allow time for parking, check in and to get settled and comfortable.Cost: Ticket options below. Tickets available at the door, space permitting.$45 Early Bird General Admission - Check in at 6:30pm$50 Early Bird VIP - Check in at 6:15pm$55 Early Bird Hall Of Fame - 6:00pm Front of the line check in + 1crystal and 1 stick of Palo SantoStarting 12/15$50 General Admission - Check in at 6:30pm$55 VIP - Check in at 6:15pm$60 Hall Of Fame - 6:00pm Front of the line check in + 1 crystal and 1 stick of Palo SantoWhat to bring:A padded mat / thick yoga mat, blanket, pillows, water and anything else needed to make yourself comfortable while lying or sitting down. We also suggest wearing comfortable layered clothing.Important Details:NO LATE ADMITTANCE. Due to the nature of the event we are unable to accommodate late entry.Doors open at 6:00pm. Studio doors lock at 6:55 and meditation begins promptly at 7:00pm. Please arrive early to allow time for parking, check in and to get settled and comfortable.ALL SALES ARE FINAL. No refunds, exchanges or make-up sessions. If you‚Äôre unable to make it to your session, you may give your ticket to another person.Certified Sound Healing and Pranic Healing practitioner Natalie Skyy will guide you through a unique and blissful Sound Healing Meditation journey. Once participants have made themselves comfortable by either sitting or lying down each session begins with a guided meditation leading you towards a place of serenity. Participants are then immersed in a wide range of sounds created by powerful instruments taking the mind, body and soul to a state of tranquility and deep relaxation.Sound Healing Meditation participants report experiencing:‚Ä¢Reduced stress, anxiety, depression and chronic fatigue.‚Ä¢Enhanced concentration, memory and attention span.‚Ä¢Increased energy, inspiration, focus and motivation.‚Ä¢Boosts in creativity, awareness and intuition.‚Ä¢Improved quality and regulated sleep patterns.‚Ä¢Lowered blood pressure and balanced hormones.‚Ä¢Alleviated symptoms associated with grief and PTSD.‚Ä¢Deep relaxation and rejuvenation.‚Ä¢Improved mood and mental clarity.‚Ä¢Feeling centered and peaceful.‚Ä¢Relief from physical aches and pains.Additional benefits of Sound Healing Meditation sessions may include:‚Ä¢Releases energetic blocks.‚Ä¢Balances chakras also known as life-force energy centers.‚Ä¢Assists in creating new neural pathways.‚Ä¢Breaks old patterns and habits.‚Ä¢Activates higher states of consciousness.‚Ä¢Enhances brain and neurological function.‚Ä¢Balances both hemispheres of the brain.‚Ä¢The sounds created cannot be predicted by the mind which causes the brainwaves to slow down to a profoundly relaxing and restorative Theta state. Theta waves are associated with daydreaming, creativity, imagination, self-reprogramming, and deep meditation.Read moreCategory: Health, Personal health

events.description_detail: A beautiful and heartfelt way to celebrate nature cycles and transitions with Ceremonial Cacao and Sound Healing session.üåø Equinox Gathering Series: Cacao Ceremony & Sound Healing üå∏Hosted by Cacao SpaceStep into the sacred balance of light and dark as we honor the turning of the seasons with a heart-centered series of Equinox Gatherings. Each session is a journey inward‚Äîan invitation to reconnect with your inner rhythm through the sacred medicine of ceremonial cacao and the deeply restorative vibrations of sound healing.‚ú® What to Expect:Each gathering is thoughtfully designed to support your body, mind, and spirit through seasonal transition. Together we will:üíõ Sip warm, hand-prepared ceremonial cacao in a meditative circleüé∂ Sink into deep relaxation with a live sound bath featuring crystal bowls, chimes, and earth instrumentsüå¨ Be guided through meditation and breathing practices to ground and centerüìù Reflect and release throughsharing within a safe circleüå∏ Set intentions for balance, renewal, and aligned actionWhether you‚Äôre returning to the circle or joining us for the first time, these gatherings offer a nourishing space to pause, breathe, and reawaken your inner light.üìÖ Upcoming Equinox Series Dates:June 19th 2025 ‚Äì Summer Solstice : Fire, Radiance & ExpansionSeptember 19th 2025‚Äì Autumn Equinox: Harvest & Letting GoDecember 19th 2025 ‚Äì Winter Solstice: Rest & Inner Wisdomüìç Location: 2028 Jardin Drive, Mountain View, 94040.(Note that this event is held at a private residentrial building)‚è∞ Time: 6 pmüéü Tickets: $50 for each session or $120 for 3 sessions. Discount code for regular Cacao Space guests is available.(Spaces are limited to preserve intimacy‚Äîearly booking is encouraged.)Parking down the street in the neighborhood is available.Bring your yoga mat, a blanket, water bottle, an open heart and anything that makes you feel cozy and grounded.‚ÄîCome as you are. Leave more connected.We can‚Äôt wait to share this heart-opening journey with you.üåï‚ú® Hosted with love by Ksenia of Cacao Space and Gaby of Song Pine and StoneRead moreCategory: Community, State
